title: 115_hr3284
content: The Act titled "Joint Counterterrorism Awareness Workshop Series Act of 2017" adds a new section to the Homeland Security Act called "Joint Counterterrorism Awareness Workshop Series" to enhance counterterrorism efforts. The Administrator, in consultation with the National Counterterrorism Center and the FBI Director, establishes a Joint Counterterrorism Awareness Workshop Series to enhance State and local jurisdictions' ability to prevent, respond to, and recover from terrorist attacks. The Workshop Series includes reviewing existing plans, identifying gaps, and providing assistance to address those gaps with available resources. The Administrator establishes a Workshop Series to enhance State and local jurisdictions' ability to prevent, respond to, and recover from terrorist attacks. The Workshop Series includes roles and responsibilities of participating agencies, improving situational awareness, and sharing best practices. Participating cities are selected based on funding and requests, with eligible participants including senior officials, law enforcement, and fire and rescue. The Workshop Series involves various participants such as law enforcement, fire and rescue, emergency management, and public health officials. Reports are required after each series to address key findings, lessons learned, best practices, and mitigation strategies. Annual reports are also mandated within a year of each Workshop Series. The Administrator, in consultation with relevant agencies, must submit annual reports summarizing key themes, lessons learned, and best practices from Workshop Series for 5 years. $1,000,000 is authorized annually from 2018 to 2022 for this purpose. The House of Representatives passed the Joint Counterterrorism Awareness Workshop Series on September 14, 2017.
